page.title: 09RODBOROUGH FORT
page.content: {Map Ref:- 849041 { } Just over a mile from Stroud, Rodborough Fort is situated {600 ft} above sea level.The fort is built on an important site, with extensive views over the valleys, and is thought to have once been a lookout post. The present building is an example of an 18th century folly, built in{ {1761}by Mr.George Hawker on an area of land granted by the Lord of the Manor. As the name suggests,the building has the appearance of a fort or castle, with castleated walls and a keep. Rodborough Fort is now used as a Caravan and Camping Centre surrounded by common land owned by the National Trust since{1937.}
